project_description: A simple Flutter app that switches between displaying a cat with a clock icon and a dog with a person icon when clicked.
architecture_overview: The app follows a modular architecture with distinct separation of concerns. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, with a single cubit managing the state of the displayed animal. The app comprises a single screen and a main widget that handles user interactions and state changes.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: open
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: get state
AnimalCubit --> HomeScreen: current state
HomeScreen -> AnimalWidget: display animal
User -> AnimalWidget: click
AnimalWidget -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal
AnimalCubit -> AnimalCubit: update state
AnimalCubit --> AnimalWidget: new state
AnimalWidget -> HomeScreen: update display
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit handles the state of the displayed animal. When the user clicks on the AnimalWidget, an event is sent to the AnimalCubit, which toggles the animal state between cat and dog. The updated state is then propagated back to the widget, which re-renders with the new animal.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which displays the AnimalWidget. There is no additional navigation within the app.
